page.title: 08Transport-Shops
page.content: The local inhabitant is dependent upon his own transport for getting to and from work. For shopping, a bus comes to the village twice a week taking shoppers to Axminster and Bridport. The roads are good, if some what narrow and winding. The occasional winter blizzard will temporarily cut the village off from outside contact, but roads are soon opened. Those without transport i.e. the elderly, are at a distinct disadvantage and have to reply on the generosity of neighbours to get to a doctor or to make special visits to town. Because of the disadvantage to the elderly of the lack of transport, the village shop is important to them. Unfortunately those able to drive, do buy a large percentage of goods from supermarkets or cash and carry stores, and village stores have to struggle to
